question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: SavePreviousTermInformation()] [State Corruption] If State.Candidates.Value is null, the function returns early. Can this cause State.Snapshots[input.TermNumber] to remain unset, breaking term history lookups? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: SavePreviousTermInformation()] [Business Logic] Does the snapshot only record ObtainedActiveVotedVotesAmount without considering locked or expired votes, potentially misrepresenting the actual election results? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: SavePreviousTermInformation()] [Integer Overflow] Can input.MinedBlocks or input.RoundNumber overflow or be negative, corrupting the snapshot data? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: SavePreviousTermInformation()] [DOS] Can an extremely large Candidates list cause the foreach loop to consume excessive gas, preventing snapshot creation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: SavePreviousTermInformation()] [State Corruption] Can State.CandidateVotes[pubkey.ToHex()] returning null for some candidates cause them to be recorded with zero votes even if they had votes in a previous snapshot? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: SavePreviousTermInformation()] [Business Logic] Does overwriting State.Snapshots[input.TermNumber] without checking if it already exists allow snapshot manipulation through repeated calls? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ElectionContract_Maintainence.cs] [Function: UpdateCandidateInformation(string,long,List)] [State Corruption] If candidateInformation is null, the function returns without error. Can this silently fail to update term participation for valid candidates? (Low)
